  • hair so long 髟 that it stops one while eating 此: mustache
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 此 indicates the sound; 髟 (hair) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
胡髭 [ hú zī ]: beard and mustache
浓眉短髭 [ nóng méi duǎn zī ]: bushy eyebrows and stubbly chin (idiom)

Ru_Radicals: 匕 (ложка), 彡 (украшение), 止 (останавливать), 長 (длинный), 髟 (волосы)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: this (此) hair (髟) is your beard
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze is like a human figure standing upright, with a beard on the mouth, the original meaning is the beard on the mouth. Inscriptions from " big " from " mouth " to the strokes of the elephant beard (indicated by ◎), like a person standing upright, exaggerating his mouth, with a beard on his mouth, the original meaning is the beard on the mouth. Later, on the basis of the pictographic initial writing, " this " was added as a sound symbol, which was seen in the Dayuding. Xiaozhuan intention operator " shall " instead of pictographic beginning of the text ( " shall " is " to be the beginning of the text", like the hair on the cheeks), became the " must ", " this Phonogram" sound, scribe as " Zi " or " Zi "; later signifier " subject " but also changed to " shaggy " become " mustache " word. "Shuowen": "Kai, mustache on the mouth. From the mustache, this sound." Duan Yucai's note: "On the mouth and on the cheeks are also named mustache."

Oracle bone inscriptions are used as names, and bronze inscriptions are used as clan names. The name " moustache " in oracle bone inscriptions and the graphic characters of inscriptions belong to the same family, and the names of people in Shang Dynasty are often their clan (Qiu Xigui).

The inscriptions also pass falsely as "祡", which is used as the name of the sacrifice. The big dingding: "Moustache (祡), Zuo, Si", Zuo, Zuo, and Si are the names of three kinds of sacrifices. "Shuowen": "Xiao, burn wood to sacrifice to the gods", it can be seen that " Xiao " is a sacrifice to worship the gods by burning wood.

" Moustache " originally refers to the beard on the mouth, "Yuefu Poetry Collection. Xianghe Songs Three. "Mo Shang Sang": "The traveler sees Luo Fu, he bears the mustache." Later, it refers to the beard in general. Han Yu "Send to Cui Twenty-Six Lizhi": "Receive the department for consecutive years, if you take off the moustache."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscription is like a human figure standing upright, with a beard on the mouth, and the original meaning is the beard on the mouth.
humanum_full_description:
金文象一個正面站立的人形，嘴巴上面長着鬍子，本義是嘴上面的鬍鬚。金文從「大」從「口」從象鬍子的筆畫（以◎表示），象一個正面站立的人，誇大其口，口上長着鬍子，本義是口上面的鬍鬚。後來在象形初文的基礎上加「此」為聲符，見於大盂鼎。小篆用意符「須」來代替象形初文（「須」是「鬚」的初文，象面頰上的毛），成為從「須」，「此」聲的形聲字，隸作「頿」或「頾」；後來意符「須」又可換為「髟」，成為「髭」字。《說文》：「頿，口上須也。从須，此聲。」段玉裁注：「在口上、在頰亦得名須。」

　　甲骨文用作人名，金文用作族氏名，甲骨文的人名「髭」與金文之圖形文字大概屬於同一族，商代人名往往即是其族氏（裘錫圭）。

　　金文又通假作「祡」，用作祭名，大盂鼎：「髭（祡）、烝、祀」，祡、烝、祀是三種祭祀的名稱。《說文》：「祡，燒柴焚燎以祭天神」，可見「祡」是燒柴來敬拜天神的祭祀。

　　「髭」本指嘴上邊的鬍鬚，《樂府詩集．相和歌辭三．陌上桑》：「行者見羅敷，下擔捋髭鬚。」後泛指鬍須，韓愈〈寄崔二十六立之〉：「連年收科第，若摘頷底髭。」
humanum_short_description: 金文象一個正面站立的人形，嘴巴上面長着鬍子，本義是嘴上面的鬍鬚。

金文象一個正面站立的人形，嘴巴上面長着鬍子，本義是嘴上面的鬍鬚。金文從「 大 」從「 口 」從象鬍子的筆畫（以◎表示），象一個正面站立的人，誇大其口，口上長着鬍子，本義是口上面的鬍鬚。後來在象形初文的基礎上加「 此 」為聲符，見於大盂鼎。小篆用意符「 須 」來代替象形初文（「 須 」是「 鬚 」的初文，象面頰上的毛），成為從「 須 」，「 此 」聲的形聲字，隸作「 頿 」或「 頾 」；後來意符「 須 」又可換為「 髟 」，成為「 髭 」字。《說文》：「頿，口上須也。从須，此聲。」段玉裁注：「在口上、在頰亦得名須。」 甲骨文用作人名，金文用作族氏名，甲骨文的人名「 髭 」與金文之圖形文字大概屬於同一族，商代人名往往即是其族氏（裘錫圭）。 金文又通假作「 祡 」，用作祭名，大盂鼎：「髭（祡）、烝、祀」，祡、烝、祀是三種祭祀的名稱。《說文》：「祡，燒柴焚燎以祭天神」，可見「 祡 」是燒柴來敬拜天神的祭祀。 「 髭 」本指嘴上邊的鬍鬚，《樂府詩集．相和歌辭三．陌上桑》：「行者見羅敷，下擔捋髭鬚。」後泛指鬍須，韓愈〈寄崔二十六立之〉：「連年收科第，若摘頷底髭。」

Later, on the basis of the pictographic initial writing, " this" was added as a sound symbol, which was seen in the Dayuding. Xiaozhuan intention operator " shall" instead of pictographic beginning of the text ( " shall" is " to be the beginning of the text", like the hair on the cheeks), became the " must", " this Phonogram" sound, scribe as " Zi" or " Zi"; later signifier " subject" but also changed to " shaggy" become " mustache" word. Liushutong characters (2)

髭字的基本解释

髭
zī
嘴上边的胡子：髭须。

髭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zī］
［《廣韻》即移切，平支，精。］
(1)嘴唇上边的胡子。
(2)泛指胡须。
(3)动物嘴上的胡须。
(4)方言。毛发直竖张散。参见“髭毛”。

髭字的英文翻译

◎ 髭
moustache, mustache, mustachio

髭字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【髟字部】　髭； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1453第20
【唐韻】卽移切【集韻】【韻會】將支切，?音貲。【說文】本作頿。口上須也。【註】今俗別作髭，非是。【釋名】髭，姿也。爲姿容之美也。

髭字的源字形

髭字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zī］
["Guangyun" is moving and cutting, flat branch, fine. ]
(1) The beard on the lips.
(2) Refers to beard in general.
(3) The beard on the animal's mouth.
(4) Dialects. The hair is splayed upright. See "Mustache Hair".

【Haiji Chapter 1】【髟字部】　髭; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 1453 20
[Tang Yun] Move and cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme] Cut the branch, and the sound will be cut. [Said the text] This is a 頿. Must also be in the mouth. [Note] Don't make a mustache in modern folks, it's not true. [Release name] Moustache, posture. For the beauty of appearance.

Пиктофонетические символы.
Тень означает, что ее древние символы напоминают старика с бородой и волосами, указывая на то, что усы - это борода на рту; это (ci) означает звук.
Усы - это борода у рта.
